sentences.en: 'Steamer'was a nickname which, for some reason, the proles applied to rocket bombs.
sentences.cn: 不晓得为什么, 无产者给火箭弹起了个外号, 叫做“轮船”.

sentences.en: Andrew roared with delight when he heard Rachel's nickname for the baby.
sentences.cn: 安德鲁听到雷切尔给婴儿起的绰号时，不禁高兴得大笑起来。

sentences.en: He doesn't like others to call him by his nickname.
sentences.cn: 他不喜欢别人叫他的外号.

sentences.en: He governed with an adroitness that gained him the nickname "the old fox".
sentences.cn: 他因管理有方而为自己赢得了“老狐狸”的绰号。

sentences.en: He resents being called by his nickname.
sentences.cn: 他忌讳人家叫他的外号.

sentences.en: His family's Cantonese nickname for him translates as Never Sits Still.
sentences.cn: 家人为他起的广东话绰号意思是NeverSitsStill（从来坐不住）。

sentences.en: If your Student a nickname will be included here.
sentences.cn: 如果你的学生有昵称或绰号,也包括在这里.

sentences.en: Rob is a nickname for Robert.
Rob is a nickname of Robert.
She called me by my nickname.
She delighted in the nickname, the "iron lady".
sentences.cn: 她喜爱这个昵称——“铁娘子”。

sentences.en: She professed to hate her nickname.
sentences.cn: 她自称痛恨自己的外号。

sentences.en: She was nicknamed Sunny because of her happy nature.
sentences.cn: 她因生性快乐而被人叫做“开心果”。

sentences.en: Stephen earned himself the nickname Hawkeye.
sentences.cn: 斯蒂芬得了个“鹰眼”的绰号。

sentences.en: The nickname clung to him throughout his life.
sentences.cn: 这个诨名儿跟了他一辈子.
人们一直叫着她这个外号.

sentences.en: This nickname will stick to him.
sentences.cn: 他这个绰号将一直被人叫下去.

sentences.en: When he got older I nicknamed him Little Alf.
sentences.cn: 他长大些后，我给他起了绰号“小阿尔夫”。

trans.tran_en: a name given to someone, especially by their friends or family, that is not their real name and is often connected with what they look like or something they have done
If you nickname someone or something, you give them an informal name

trans.tran_cn: 给…起绰号，用诨名[爱称]称呼，叫错名字
trans.tran_en: If you nickname someone or something, you give them an informal name
